nodes.text: Ufsa'mak'ro, better known by his core name Samakro, was a Chiss male who served as the first officer of Senior Captain Mitth'raw'nuruodo aboard the Chiss Ascendancy cruiser Springhawk.
Samakro held the rank of cousin of the Ruling Ufsa family.

Samakro suspected Caregiver Mitth'ali'astov of being a spy for Syndics of the Mitth family, particularly Mitth'urf'ianico. He believed anyone trying to take down Thrawn would have no qualms taking down the entire crew of the Springhawk with him. Samakro tried to prove his theory that Thalias was a spy during the Nikardun campaigns by telling the caregiver a false but plausible-sounding explanation for some of Thrawn's decisions.  Syndic Thurfian had indeed attempted to recruit Thalias to be his personal spy against Thrawn, but she refused and escaped his blackmail by becoming a Trial-born of the Mitth.

Samakro often held private reservations, objections, frustrations or even anger towards his commanding officer Thrawn and his tactics. However, Samakro was a very disciplined Chiss officer, and enforced obedience to protocol and the chain of command to his subordinates. Samakro had a strong dislike for family politics, believing it always led to disaster when it penetrated Fleet business.
Ufsa'mak'ro first appeared in the 2020 novel Thrawn Ascendancy: Chaos Rising as a secondary character, and one from whose point of view events were often described.

In the dramatis personae of Chaos Rising, Samakro is listed as a merit adoptive of the Ufsa family. In its 2021 sequel, Thrawn Ascendancy: Greater Good, Samakro is listed as having the rank of cousin of the Ufsa. This would be considered quite the promotion—3 whole family ranks—especially as novels imply that Chiss admitted to a family as merit adoptives rarely if ever attained the rank of cousin. Furthermore, Greater Good is set approximately one year after Chaos Rising, which would be a very short time for such a promotion.
